text: w x y z hi everyone ABC Anthony fantani
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
always Project Blue rev after five long
years the Toronto Indie pop and rock
outfit always is back handing in their
third full-length LP I remember back in
the 2010s when the band originally
arrived to us with I thought more style
than substance their first and breakout
album was a collection of a very Twee
Indie tracks that sounded old school as
hell they were competently put together
but there wasn't a lot about them that I
found to be stand out but then suddenly
the band had abundance where they were
once lacking on their follow-up album a
few years later anti-socialites with
more stunning songs Fuller production a
more versatile array of indie rock
styles and instrumentals being showcased
sure maybe the band's approach to some
sounds was a little generic Eric and
Pastiche but outside of that what's not
to love someone's gotta hold the Indie
fort down and now with blue rev it feels
like the band is trying to up the ante
once again taking all the Indie and Twee
and pop and jangly Vibes they've built
their career on thus far and now
introducing some more abstract sound
play on top of it along the lines of
shoegaze noise pop dream pop and of
course this change in Pace led to a lot
of highlights there's the track easy on
your own which has grown on me since I
first heard it a very Bittersweet Little
Indie tuna wash in all of the shoegazy
Bliss lots of thick layers of humming
guitar chords and noise paired with the
song so sweet it cuts through all the
haze pretty easily especially with front
woman Molly Rankin's vocal sounding more
impassioned here than they were on the
last record which helps a lot during
this track's very syrupy Bridge as well
as several other climaxes later on the
lp with the track after the earthquake
the band goes in a bit more of a jingle
pop Direction much more stripped back
but still sounding really good because
the song at the core of the whole thing
is quality which really is enough even
if the band's style isn't Reinventing
the Indie wheel very online guy is
another huge highlight for me from the
lp where the band tries their hand at
some very synthy hypnagogic pop and they
sound great doing it overall it's such a
Snappy instantly addictive tune that has
some food for thought when it comes to
egoism and social media addiction plus I
love all the little Sonic details of the
track between the keys and the vocal
harmonies and some of the odd
manipulated what sounds like uh you know
tape warped background vocal bits too
the track is equal parts nostalgic and
surreal there's also tile by tile which
I found to be one of the most enveloping
songs on the entire LP a luscious ballad
whose pillowy mix I could really just
lay down in pass out forever with it on
repeat just a really good dream pop
highlight from the thing then of course
there's the hard switch over on the next
track to Pomeranian spinster which is a
really fun quirky highlight where the
band suddenly goes into a post-punk
Direction with some driving bass some
weird guitar work there's something much
speedier and even aggressive about it in
comparison with the other tracks here
just seems like no matter what
underground style always put their thumb
on here they end up doing it pretty well
so yeah there are a lot of Great Cuts on
this LP to be had songs were the band's
clearly getting more ambitious with the
musical styles they're embracing
experimentation effects layers but
occasionally the crazy soup of ideas
they present to the listener doesn't
necessarily come off as uh all that
novel or clear the track pressed for
example starts with a lot of pep in its
step but the songwriting doesn't come
across as strong on this one the melodic
ideas on the track stale out relatively
fast and meanwhile the abrupt ending
leaves me feeling pretty cold and for me
the track Tom verlane pretty much sounds
like any given Twi record from Glasgow
early 90s nothing more nothing less it's
decent emulation even though I know the
band is capable of so much more because
the song many mirrors on this very
record seems to pull from from the exact
same influence in terms of time and
place but comes through with much
sharper shoegaze guitars and a better
tune plus the fiery blown out guitar
solo at the very end is amazing so yeah
in the tracklist there are some tracks
that pale in comparison to others but
the real issue I have with this LP
overall is that it does not end as
strong as it starts the track Belinda
says brings more heavy shoegaze guitars
but in this instance they feel like more
of a cover-up for the lack of a strong
song at the core here board in Bristol
has this endlessly groovy bass line that
I like a lot but this
um kind of low-fi synth pop mix that
they have going on leaves the track
feeling much more muted Dusty and Hollow
than anything else on the tracklist
meanwhile the vocal and synth passage
that is fourth figure is really this
record going out with a whipper and once
more the quality in terms of uh sounds
and songwriting from the first leg of
the record to the last leg of the record
it's really night and day I was just
really hoping the record would pull
through through all the way through and
I I just don't think it quite does so
because of that even though there were
some amazing and very creative Peaks on
this album that I'm really impressed
with that showed to me that this band is
continuing to evolve progress try new
things but the record is still not that
consistent in my view and as a result of
that I cannot come here and tell you
that in my opinion I think they've
brought a better crop of songs than they
did on their last record but for sure
blue rev is still a good one and easily
one of the most colorful indie rock
records you're going to hear this year I
recommend that you try it if this is
your Vibe if this is your style without
a doubt I'm feeling a light to decent
seven on this one transition have you
given this album a listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
blue rev Always Forever
